derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English crustarde, custarde (denoting an open pie containing meat or fruit in a spiced or sweetened sauce thickened with eggs), from Old French crouste (see crust)

entry.tran: 蛋奶沙司(与水果、布丁一同食用)
entry.def: Custard is a sweet yellow sauce made from milk and eggs or from milk and a powder. It is eaten with fruit and puddings.

means.word_mean: 1. sweetened mixture of milk and eggs baked or boiled or frozen

Sentence.sentence: Some restaurants go for custard made fresh with eggs, sugar and cream, but British custard is different, and we stay true to that.
